name: Za'atar Pork Chops with Roasted Green Beans and Lemon-Tahini Drizzle
description: Seared pork chops finished with za'atar and lemon, served alongside oven-roasted green beans and a simple tahini drizzle. Keto-friendly, mild, and weeknight quick.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and place a rimmed baking tray inside to preheat.
Trim green beans and pat dry.
Zest lemon, then cut and juice it (reserve 2 tablespoons juice).
Pat pork chops dry; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk tahini with 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt until smooth; adjust with a bit more lemon juice or olive oil to reach drizzle consistency.
cook_steps: In a bowl, toss green beans with 1 tablespoon olive oil, half the minced garlic, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Spread green beans on the hot baking tray and roast for 12–15 minutes, tossing once, until tender-crisp and lightly browned.
While beans roast, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until well browned.

Sprinkle za'atar over the chops and add 1 tablespoon lemon juice to the pan; baste chops for 30 seconds. If chops are thick, transfer skillet to the oven for 3–5 minutes to finish (internal temp about 63°C/145°F).
Rest pork chops on a plate for 3–5 minutes. Return skillet to low heat with remaining minced garlic and 1 teaspoon olive oil if dry; warm 30 seconds.
Add roasted green beans and lemon zest to the skillet; toss to coat and season to taste with salt and black pepper.
Plate pork chops with green beans. Drizzle chops with the tahini sauce and sprinkle with chopped parsley.
